definition: disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: Snow white tried in vain to please her step-mother.
sentences.chinese: 白雪公主嘗試取悅後母是徒勞的。

sentences.english: Or grieve at my Fate, when I know 'tis in vain?
sentences.chinese: 或哀怨我的命運，當我知道這一切都是徒勞？

sentences.english: The giants of management education have laboured mightily to bring forth a molehill.
sentences.chinese: 這些管理學教育界的巨頭們實在是徒勞微功。

sentences.english: But someone else's way of looking at things – Barthelme's, for instance – should not be chased after by other writers.
sentences.chinese: 一味地追隨和模仿他人對事物的觀察方法是徒勞的。

sentences.english: Admiring it and adding noughts in vain.
sentences.chinese: 讚賞着它，徒勞地做着零與零的加法。

sentences.english: The barrenness of their effort is due to poor management.
sentences.chinese: 他們努力的徒勞無益歸咎於管理不善。

sentences.english: It would be idle to pretend the system is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 假裝系統完美無疵是徒勞的。

sentences.english: She springs up to the window again, screaming for help in vain.
sentences.chinese: 她再次衝到窗邊，徒勞地喊叫，尋求幫助。

sentences.english: And the action is futile, because it is simply the occupation of a neurotic mind.
sentences.chinese: 那種行動是徒勞的，因爲它只是神經症的頭腦的佔領。

sentences.english: To sacrifice moments in your life now for those that are dead and gone is a wasteful endeavor.
sentences.chinese: 爲了已經逝去的過往犧牲生命中當下的時間是徒勞的。

sentences.english: But trying to legislate trade balance is a fool's errand.
sentences.chinese: 然而，要知道通過立法來平衡貿易只是徒勞。

sentences.english: True philosophy was supplanted by dogmatic opinions. The pundits took delight in vain polemics .
sentences.chinese: 梵文學者爲了徒勞無益的辯論術而感到高興。

sentences.english: All the efforts he invested were in vain.
sentences.chinese: 所有那些他付出的努力都是徒勞無果的。

sentences.english: It is useless attacking the insensible.
sentences.chinese: 攻擊無知覺的東西是徒勞的。

sentences.english: It's a futile aim, says Hitchings.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個徒勞的目標，希欽斯說。

sentences.english: The matter itself I could not deny, and vain was every endeavour to soften it.
sentences.chinese: 事情本身我無法否認，企圖大事化小也是徒勞無益的。

definition: to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
no matter what/despite/to allow (sb to act arbitrarily)
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
all one's hopes and efforts come to nothing/futile
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
